$addons.title: Addons
$addons.description:
Addons defines a list of keys used to identify tax addons that apply special
normalization, scenarios, and validation rules to a document.

$tags.title: Tags
$tags.description:
Tags are used to help identify specific tax scenarios or requirements that may
apply changes to the contents of the document or imply a specific meaning.
Converters may use tags to help identify specific situations that do not have
a specific extension, for example; self-billed or partial invoices may be
identified by their respective tags.

oneOf.title: Purchase Order
oneOf.description: A purchase order is a document that a buyer sends to a seller to request goods or services.

oneOf.title: Sales Order
oneOf.description: A sales order is a document that a seller sends to a buyer to confirm the sale of goods or services.

oneOf.title: Quote
oneOf.description: A quote is a document that a seller sends to a buyer to provide a price for goods or services.

series.title: Series
series.description:
Series is used to identify groups of orders by date, business area, project,
type, customer, a combination of any, or other company specific data.
If the output format does not support the series as a separate field, it will be
prepended to the code for presentation with a dash (`-`) for separation.

code.title: Code
code.description:
Code is a sequential identifier that uniquely identifies the order. The code can
be left empty initially, but is **required** to **sign** the document.

issue_time.title: Issue Time
issue_time.description:
IssueTime is an optional field that may be useful to indicate the time of day when
the order was issued. Some regions and formats may require this field to be set.
An empty string will be automatically updated to reflect the current time, otherwise
the field can be left with a nil value.

op_date.title: Operation Date
op_date.description: Date when the operation defined by the invoice became effective.

value_date.title: Value Date
value_date.description: When the taxes of this invoice become accountable, if none set, the issue date is used.

exchange_rates.title: Exchange Rates
exchange_rates.description: Exchange rates to be used when converting the invoices monetary values into other currencies.

preceding.title: Preceding Details
preceding.description: Key information regarding previous order documents.

identities.title: Identities
identities.description: Additional codes, IDs, SKUs, or other regional or custom identifiers that may be used to identify the order.

period.title: Period
period.description: Period of time in which the order is valid.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: The entity supplying the goods or services and usually responsible for paying taxes.

customer.title: Customer
customer.description: Legal entity receiving the goods or services, may be nil in certain circumstances such as simplified invoices.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: Party who is responsible for issuing payment, if not the same as the customer.

seller.title: Seller
seller.description: Seller is the party liable to pay taxes on the transaction if not the same as the supplier.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: List of lines representing each of the items to be ordered.

discounts.title: Discounts
discounts.description: Discounts or allowances applied to order totals

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Charges or surcharges applied to order totals

payment.title: Payment Details
payment.description: Information on when, how, and to whom a final invoice would be paid.

delivery.title: Delivery Details
delivery.description: Specific details on delivery of the goods to copy to the final invoice.

totals.title: Totals
totals.description: Summary of all the order totals, including taxes (calculated).

notes.title: Notes
notes.description:
Unstructured information that is relevant to the order, such as correction or additional
legal details.

complements.title: Complements
complements.description: Additional complementary objects that add relevant information to the order.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Additional semi-structured data that doesn't fit into the body of the order.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description:
Attachments provide additional information or supporting documents that are not included
in the main document. It is important that attachments are not used for alternative
versions of the PDF, for that, see "links" inside the envelope headers.

Order.description: Order documents are used for the initial part of a order-to-invoice process where the buyer requests goods or services from the seller.
